trans-unit.source: Sharing an ExpressRoute Circuit Across Multiple Subscriptions | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Sharing an ExpressRoute Circuit Across Multiple Subscriptions | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: This article walks you through sharing your ExpressRoute circuit across multiple Azure subscriptions.
trans-unit.target: This article walks you through sharing your ExpressRoute circuit across multiple Azure subscriptions.

trans-unit.source: Sharing an ExpressRoute circuit across multiple subscriptions
trans-unit.target: Sharing an ExpressRoute circuit across multiple subscriptions

trans-unit.source: A single ExpressRoute circuit can be shared across multiple subscriptions.
trans-unit.target: A single ExpressRoute circuit can be shared across multiple subscriptions.

trans-unit.source: Figure 1 shows a simple schematic of how sharing ExpressRoute circuits across multiple subscriptions works.
trans-unit.target: Figure 1 shows a simple schematic of how sharing ExpressRoute circuits across multiple subscriptions works.

trans-unit.source: Each of the smaller clouds within the large cloud is used to represent subscriptions belonging to different departments within an organization.
trans-unit.target: Each of the smaller clouds within the large cloud is used to represent subscriptions belonging to different departments within an organization.

trans-unit.source: Each of the departments within the organization can use their own subscription for deploying their services but can share a single ExpressRoute dedicated circuit to connect back to the corporate network.
trans-unit.target: Each of the departments within the organization can use their own subscription for deploying their services but can share a single ExpressRoute dedicated circuit to connect back to the corporate network.

trans-unit.source: A single department (in this example: IT) can own the ExpressRoute dedicated circuit.
trans-unit.target: A single department (in this example: IT) can own the ExpressRoute dedicated circuit.

trans-unit.source: Connectivity and bandwidth charges for the dedicated circuit will be applied to the dedicated circuit owner.
trans-unit.target: Connectivity and bandwidth charges for the dedicated circuit will be applied to the dedicated circuit owner.

trans-unit.source: Other subscriptions within the organization can use the ExpressRoute circuit.
trans-unit.target: Other subscriptions within the organization can use the ExpressRoute circuit.

trans-unit.source: Figure 1
trans-unit.target: Figure 1

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Subscription Sharing</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Subscription Sharing</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Administration
trans-unit.target: Administration

trans-unit.source: The circuit owner is the administrator/co-administrator of the subscription in which the ExpressRoute dedicated circuit is created.
trans-unit.target: The circuit owner is the administrator/co-administrator of the subscription in which the ExpressRoute dedicated circuit is created.

trans-unit.source: The circuit owner can authorize administrators/co-administrators of other subscriptions (referred to as circuit user in the Workflow diagram) to use the dedicated circuit they own.
trans-unit.target: The circuit owner can authorize administrators/co-administrators of other subscriptions (referred to as circuit user in the Workflow diagram) to use the dedicated circuit they own.

trans-unit.source: Circuit users authorized to use the organization's dedicated circuit can link VNet in their subscription to the dedicated circuit once they are authorized.
trans-unit.target: Circuit users authorized to use the organization's dedicated circuit can link VNet in their subscription to the dedicated circuit once they are authorized.

trans-unit.source: The circuit owner has the power to modify and revoke authorizations at any time.
trans-unit.target: The circuit owner has the power to modify and revoke authorizations at any time.

trans-unit.source: Revoking an authorization will result in all links being deleted from the subscription whose access was revoked.
trans-unit.target: Revoking an authorization will result in all links being deleted from the subscription whose access was revoked.

trans-unit.source: Workflow
trans-unit.target: Workflow

trans-unit.source: The circuit owner authorizes the administrators of other subscriptions to use the specified circuit.
trans-unit.target: The circuit owner authorizes the administrators of other subscriptions to use the specified circuit.

trans-unit.source: In the example below, the administrator of the circuit (Contoso IT) enables the administrator of another subscription (Contoso Sales), by specifying their Microsoft ID, to link up to 2 VNETs to the circuit.
trans-unit.target: In the example below, the administrator of the circuit (Contoso IT) enables the administrator of another subscription (Contoso Sales), by specifying their Microsoft ID, to link up to 2 VNETs to the circuit.

trans-unit.source: The cmdlet doesn't send email to the specified Microsoft ID.
trans-unit.target: The cmdlet doesn't send email to the specified Microsoft ID.

trans-unit.source: The circuit owner need to explicitly notify the other subscription owner that the authorization is complete.
trans-unit.target: The circuit owner need to explicitly notify the other subscription owner that the authorization is complete.

trans-unit.source: Once notified by the circuit owner, the administrator of the authorized subscription can run the following cmdlet to retrieve the service key of the circuit.
trans-unit.target: Once notified by the circuit owner, the administrator of the authorized subscription can run the following cmdlet to retrieve the service key of the circuit.

trans-unit.source: In this example, the administrator of Contoso Sales must first sign in using the specified Microsoft ID, salesadmin@contoso.com.
trans-unit.target: In this example, the administrator of Contoso Sales must first sign in using the specified Microsoft ID, salesadmin@contoso.com.

trans-unit.source: The administrator of the authorized subscription runs the following cmdlet to complete the link operation.
trans-unit.target: The administrator of the authorized subscription runs the following cmdlet to complete the link operation.

trans-unit.source: And that's it.
trans-unit.target: And that's it.

trans-unit.source: Conto's Sales VNet on Azure is now linked to a circuit created/owned by ContosoIT.
trans-unit.target: Conto's Sales VNet on Azure is now linked to a circuit created/owned by ContosoIT.

trans-unit.source: Managing authorization
trans-unit.target: Managing authorization

trans-unit.source: The circuit owner can share a circuit with up to 10 Azure subscriptions.
trans-unit.target: The circuit owner can share a circuit with up to 10 Azure subscriptions.

trans-unit.source: The circuit owner can view who has been authorized to the circuit.
trans-unit.target: The circuit owner can view who has been authorized to the circuit.

trans-unit.source: The owner can revoke the authorization at any time.
trans-unit.target: The owner can revoke the authorization at any time.

trans-unit.source: When the circuit owner revokes an authorization, identified by LinkAuthorizationId, all links permitted by that authorization will be deleted immediately.
trans-unit.target: When the circuit owner revokes an authorization, identified by LinkAuthorizationId, all links permitted by that authorization will be deleted immediately.

trans-unit.source: The linked VNETs will lose connectivity to the on-premises network through the ExpressRoute circuit.
trans-unit.target: The linked VNETs will lose connectivity to the on-premises network through the ExpressRoute circuit.
